text: Shammi madam the teenager who left
Britain to join the extremist group the
so-called Islamic state is to lose her
British citizenship she was 15 when she
left
she's now 19 and in a refugee camp in
Syria with a newborn baby a statement
from her family in London says they are
very disappointed at the news and will
consider all legal avenues to challenge
the Home Office decision Keith Doyle has
more details Shamima Begum says she
wants to come back to Britain with her
newborn baby that now looks unlikely
anytime soon after her family received a
letter from the Home Office stating that
the Home Secretary had decided to
deprive her of her Pradesh citizenship
the 19 year old left the UK at the age
of 15 to join the Islamic state group
now in a refugee camp in Syria she's
caused outrage by acquainting the terror
attack at a Manchester concert to
coalition bombings of is areas in Syria
like the woman children most are being
killed right now unjustly
the bombings it's a two-way thing
the Home Secretary Sajid Javid said the
decision to take away her British
citizenship was not taken lightly but
his priority is the safety and security
of Britain and the people who live here
it seems to be of a knee-jerk reaction
the family are very very surprised at
that I think we just seem to have lost
sight of the you know if you look at
what was happening 15 years went with a
15 year old child we now have a 19 year
old woman who is traumatized she's she's
been brainwashed British citizenship
can't be taken away as long as the
person is not left stateless the Home
Office believes shamina Begum is
entitled to Bangladeshi citizenship her
family say they're considering all legal
avenues to challenge the Home
Secretary's decision
Keith Doyle BBC news
